page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY CHURCH WINDOWS
page.content: St Neot church windows. The west window of the north aisle is the St George window.Like the St Neot window this presents life like scenes from the legendary history of the Saint.In the centre is seen the madallion of the order of the red cross knights,representing St George slaying the dragon whilst on either side is his shield with his traditional red cross.The east window at the high altar is the work of Hedgeland as are the two windows in the organ chamber.The Armorial window was also designed by him.The window was donated by another well known family-the Grylls.This contains arms of the Grylls family with dates ranging from 1530 to that of the donor and his wife.This is in a scroll which says, "Grylls and Hill 1783".
